snippet: In Guinea’s Forest Region, villages that have refused outside help to fight the Ebola outbreak are starting to soften their resistance.
abstract: Dandano Journal; villagers in Dandano and elsewhere in Guinea's inaccessible Forest Region are beginning to relent after refusing help from outsiders in combating Ebola outbreak; fear of unknown caused villagers to blockade roads and defy intervention by Red Cross, allowing disease to spread unchecked for months; health care workers now face far more difficult job in tracking down victims and those who had contact with them.
lead_paragraph: In Guinea’s Forest Region, villages that have refused outside help to fight the Ebola outbreak are starting to soften their resistance.

headline.main: Fear of Ebola Opens Wary Villages to Outsiders in Guinea
headline.print_headline: Fear of Ebola Opens Wary Villages to Outsiders
